channel.title: Posts on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Location of UK green SMEs
item.description: BEIS Logitudinal Small Business Survey 2021 The latest wave of the survey of SMEs by the UK Department for Business Energy and Industrial Strategy has 3 years of data on green small businesses. The data show the location of green SMEs in all the nations of the UK and by postcode. The code to obtain a map of these locations is generated using the maps and ggplot libraries. RColorBrewer adds cool palettes:

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. I’ve modified the original code. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.

item.title: displaying beautiful tables with Bootstrap Tables
item.description: Using markdown to display tables is easy. Just use the following syntax: | Left aligned | Center aligned | Right aligned | | :----------- | :------------: | ------------: | | Left 1 | center 1 | right 1 | | Left 2 | center 2 | right 2 | | Left 3 | center 3 | right 3 | That will generate: Left aligned Center aligned Right aligned Left 1 center 1 right 1 Left 2 center 2 right 2 Left 3 center 3 right 3 It is also possible to use HTML to display tables.

item.title: Bulk download with R and yfR
item.description: Aim: Dowload crypto data from Yahoo Finance You can download historical financial data from Yahoo Finance directly into R and process the data without having to use Excel as an intermediate step. When you download data from Yahoo Finance, you get 1 data set in 1 csv file. If you need data for multiple time series -multiple stock returns for portfolio optimization for example- using the package yfR will automate the download and format the data for further use.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
